newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: South Korea to send trade specialist to North.
newsitem.headline: South Korea to send trade specialist to North.

text.p: South Korea will send a trade specialist to North Korea to pave the way for business ventures, a unification ministry statement said on Thursday.
Hong Ji-seon, who heads the North Korea department at state-run Korea Trade/Investment Promotion Agency, is due to visit Pyongyang between March 29 and April 5, the statement said.
Hong would sound out the possiblility of setting up an office for his agency in North Korea, the statement said.
The announcement was the latest sign that the rival Koreas were expanding contacts.

A foreign ministry spokesman said representatives of North and South Korea and the United States met in New York on Wednesday for working-level discussions over a proposal for four-nation peace talks.

It was the first working-level contact since senior representatives from the three countries met earlier this month for a ground-breaking U.S.-South Korean briefing on the peace talks, which would also include China.
